metadata.title: CVE-2019-15690 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
LibVNCServer 0.9.12 release and earlier contains heap buffer overflowvulnerability within the HandleCursorShape() function inlibvncclient/cursor.c. An attacker sends cursor shapes with speciallycrafted dimensions, which can result in remote code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15690` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.13+dfsg-1
libvncserver1 - 0.9.13+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.13+dfsg-1').
